ARTICLE VI.
COMMISSARIES OF MARKETS.
Sec. 1. The Commissaries of Markets are by
aw under the special direction and subject to
the orders of the Chief of Police ; they shall see
> that the same be swept and cleaned daily, and that
they be constantly kept in good order and con-
ition. They shall see that no person shall place
ithin the Market Houses, nor on the foot ways
thereof, nor on the space situated between the
ral markets, any other stalls or tables' than
3 fixed there by existing ordinances.
Sec. 2. It shall be the duty of the Commissaries
, of Markets to make daily a strict inspection of the
J butchers' meat, and of other provisions exposed
(for sale in said markets.
Sec. 3. It shall be the duty of the Commissaries
I of the various Markets to see that the ordinances
I relating thereto are fully enforced, and that no
1 offence is perpetrated against the farmers of the
dues of said Markets They shall maintain order
I in the Markets, and arrest or cause to be arrested
ail persons who disturb the public peace, and conduct them before the Recorder of the District in
